meanings.definition: A person who studies and predicts future trends and developments.
meanings.sent1: Futurologists analyze data to predict what may happen in the future.
meanings.sent2: Many futurologists believe technology will greatly impact our lives.
meanings.sent3: The futurologists at the conference made some interesting predictions about space travel.
meanings.sent4: She was like a futurologist, foreseeing the outcome of the project before it even started.
meanings.sent5: The image of the futurologist with a crystal ball is a popular stereotype.

meanings.definition: Those who specialize in forecasting future events and trends.
meanings.sent1: Futurologists attend seminars to learn more about upcoming trends.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a team of futurologists to help plan their strategies.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the futurologists jokingly predicted who would win the dance-off.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a group of futurologists, always thinking ahead.
meanings.sent5: The group of futurologists presented their findings on climate change to the public.
